parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma3
</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>0.50
</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> local
</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Stamina System

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Enables/Disables the person's fatigue.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> unit '''enableFatigue''' enable

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> unit: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> enable: [[Boolean]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[player]] [[enableFatigue]] [[false]];</code>
</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>{ _x [[enableFatigue]] [[false]]; } [[forEach]] ([[units]] [[group]] [[player]]);</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[getFatigue]], [[setFatigue]]
</value></part></template>

<comment><!-- CONTINUE Notes -->
</comment><dl class="command_description">
<dd class="notedate">Posted on March 24, 2015 - 16:30 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Harmdhast|Harmdhast]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
When the player dies enableFatigue is set to true after the respawn
</dd>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on January 27, 2016 - 19:17 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Pierre MGI|Pierre MGI]]</dt>
<dd class="note">
To precise the note of Harmdhast, this command is not persistent (after respawn). So, in MP, you'll have to enableFatigue false, also in onPlayerRespawn.sqf or through the MP eventHandler  MPRespawn.
</dd>
</dl>
<comment><!-- DISCONTINUE Notes --></comment></root>
